website_summaries.verdict: This conical burr grinder produces reliably even grounds and features 18 grind settings.
pros: A grinder that stands out for its quiet operation and easy-to-read LCD screen
Grinds can be dispensed into the included container or directly into a filter
Produces grounds for 1 to 14 cups of coffee
cons: Some customers reported frequent jamming, though many had no issues after several months of use

customer_reviews.title: See for yourself - as long as you can return it
customer_reviews.text: Was kinda iffy on purchasing this given a bulk of the reviews, but a lot of sites rank this high on their list of grinders.... it's been great for me, nothing has broken down, the grind is consistently even... it's been more than 2 weeks and it's still kicking! Only "issue" is that the receptacle is supposed to 'click' into place but that can be a challenge from time to time (it could still be in place w/o the 'click', but I just don't trust it until I hear it)
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: The Grind is so much more uniform with an excellent assortment of different grinds
customer_reviews.text: Replaced our older Cuisinart Grinder DBM-8 with this one. The Grind is so much more uniform with an excellent assortment of different grinds. Our only complaint is the adjusting knob on the right side of the unit is smooth and difficult to turn. However an easy fix was found using one of those small heavy duty and thick rubber bands often found around the stems of broccoli! We just installed in around the knob and it's so much easier to turn, slip proof and now turns effortlessly!
customer_reviews.author: Jeler of Iowa

customer_reviews.title: Read the other 1 star reviews- they are spot on!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I bought this door stop without reading the 1 star reviews. Assumed Cusinart was quality, but this thing is not. Lasted 2 days and keeps jamming, same as other reviewers. Returned it for a refund. Obviously a bad product design.
customer_reviews.author: J. Michael Silva

customer_reviews.title: From a 5 star to a 1, stopped grinding after only 3 days.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this unit and model from Cuisinart as it sounded heavy duty. But after only a few days of using it, the machine didn't grind anything and would bog down. Beans were getting stuck and even after cleaning it, it would not grind. I believe the motor used on this particular model is weak. I had also purchased Cuisinart CBM-18N and there's no comparison. The Cuisinart CBM-18N had a stronger motor. It's loud, but works every time. So I'm returning this one as it's too weak to grind.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: A Grinder That Could Have Been Great But Isn't
customer_reviews.text: Let start buy saying that this could have been an excellent grinder if Cuisinart hadn't cheapened the plastic pieces so much and packaged it so the bins didn't crack in shipment. We have had 3 or 4 Cuisinart grinders the past 15 years and each newer model is worse in the build quality department. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Tony No Baloney

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love the way this grinds coffee and looks, but as others have said it can clog, especially if your beans have a heavy oil from roasting. As long as you make a point to clean out the burr grinder and the chute weekly or so, we have not had any issues with it. For cleaning out the shoot we use a stiff but bendable piece of picture framing wire to work it into the discharge chute and loosen and grounds that may be accumulating. The brush cleaner provided works well for the burr grinder, just be sure to remove the part that comes out, wash it clean and fully dry it before putting it back.
customer_reviews.author: markpapp

customer_reviews.title: Eliminates the worst part of grinding beans - no more brushing out the container
customer_reviews.text: I've used several grinders from cheap and simple to other Cuisinart burr grinders and all of them require the tedious, messy, and annoying task of brushing out grinds from the container while fighting static cling. No this one. You just put the filter (paper for permanent) at the base of the grinder. You can throw out all of your brushes. Also great is that you specify the number of cups of coffee you intend to make and it automagically grinds the right amount so no more measuring. The airtight container and digital display are icing on the cake. I've had NO issues with this thing clogging and I make coffee every single day.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in Alexandria, VA

customer_reviews.title: by far the best coffee grinder at this price point
customer_reviews.text: I have used many different grinders. for under $100 you cannot beat this one. Its too bad they dont make it new anymore. it is fairly quiet. lots of different settings for the perfect grind. I am concerned how well the electronic side of things will hold up, we will see.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with how quietly it grinds. Im able to dial in for pour overs and espresso very easily. I appreciate the preset that allows the user to set an amount to grind. Just press a button and the exact amount needed grinds out. I found this especially helpful for espresso grinds. I would highly recommend this grinder!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Luukko

customer_reviews.title: Clogged after 3 weeks of use.
customer_reviews.text: This is a defective product from Cuisinart. I have contacted Cuisinart and they are replacing this unit with a better one. Great experience with the customer service on Cuisinart and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mccarthy

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: Jams a LOT. The chute is very narrow, and not easy to access because the grinding mechanism cannot be removed. I've spent way too much time with a toothpick trying to clean this machine. I use the collection bin that it comes with, and it perpetually gets coffee grinds everywhere. The lid of the bin is the worst culprit because the grinds get in the crevices of its hinges, so when you pull it out from the grinder cubby, it gets grinds all over the counter. In general, it is just a poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Laguna Girl

customer_reviews.title: A very even grind
customer_reviews.text: This grinder produces a very even grind. It is pretty quite. The controls are easy to operate. I use 1/2 of the settings. For a 12 cup pot I grind 6 to 7 cups on the display. I would give this 4 1/2 stars just because it will throw a few grounds out of the container. It does keep the grounds in the grinder and not on the counter. This should not be a deal breaker. Overall, this is a excellent machine.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Whitmore

customer_reviews.title: Died In 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Died in 2 months as motor slowly seizes and barely has any power. 1 month replacement window quoted from manufacturer. Processed about 5 lbs of beans in total.
customer_reviews.author: Survi

customer_reviews.title: Motor died after five weeks
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 5 weeks. Loved it and then the motor died. Tried to return it to Cuisinart but they wanted to charge me shipping both ways. Amazon took care of me though and took it back.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Slagle

customer_reviews.title: Went through two within 5 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I went through two of these in 5 weeks. The motor broke on both. The second one broke after grinding only a quarter of a bag of coffee. Save yourself the headache and get a different grinder...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quisinart Coffee Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a NEW coffee grinder and what I got was a used broken piece of junk. It was crammed full of coffee!! I had to remove the grinder and blow out the whole unit. Got it running and it did grind but is slow and then it plugged up. This is a waste of money. Sending this one back and go back to my food processor.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Arrell

customer_reviews.title: IT’S A MESS!!!
customer_reviews.text: This grinder looks great but it is NOT... the machine spreads the grinded coffee everywhere and makes a total mess every time. I would not spend this amount of money on this machine, no worth it. I wish I could have my money back!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo B.

customer_reviews.title: Freshly ground coffee without waking the rest of the house!
customer_reviews.text: Grinds quietly! I can grind right before each pot of coffee without fear of waking the rest of the house! The ability to select my grind and amount is much easier than my previous grinder.
customer_reviews.author: saramedic

customer_reviews.title: Great auto grinder
customer_reviews.text: It has a dosage control function. So you won’t need to weight the beans every time.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Jeng

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these grinders and it was perfect till it died on the 3rd week and I only used it once a day. I replaced it with exact same model thinking the first one was defected, exact same thing happened for the second grinder the motor had no power and would not grind. Nothing worse than a tool you can not trust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart products not what they used to be!
customer_reviews.text: Clogged up after only 3rd use. Extremely random dosing amounts at same setting. Leaves grounds all over counter - poor design in so many ways.
customer_reviews.author: The Mango Man

customer_reviews.title: Stopped grinding
customer_reviews.text: Our Coffee grinder stopped grinding after only one month/one bag of beans. We have a replacement coming but that'll take about 24 working days to arrive . We purchased this brand as its supposed to be good quality products. Defiantly not value for money and I wouldn't buy one again.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder!
customer_reviews.text: I love this grinder! I got it as a step up from my last one and it works great. It is quieter which is important to me. It also grinds exactly the right amount of coffee when programmed right and is easy to program.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Ellett

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace my old one that broke (different grinder). This one had good reviews for a good price. Great grinder so far. It is quieter than my old one (still loud enough to wake someone, probably), but it’s at a lower pitch, which is nice. Not so jarring when one is not yet caffeinated.
customer_reviews.author: Will S

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: After clearing out jammed coffee multiple times in the few weeks we have owned this one, this is getting returned. Terrible design, do not buy. We had another grinder that never clogged in years.
customer_reviews.author: Rosanne Morison

customer_reviews.title: I return it.
customer_reviews.text: I got this product 3 days ago. It can only work for the first 3 times then it stuck. I tried to clean it, but it doesn't work again. I will return it.
customer_reviews.author: LI, C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and quite!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a number of burr graders over the years and this one is by far the quietest and easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome coffee grider
customer_reviews.text: We owned a few different type of coffee grinders and we love this one the best. You can grind right into your coffee filter without the mess!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy, just pour in the beans and they feed nicely. I haven’t had any jamming or grounds sticking in the chute. Fresh coffee is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Al Howard

customer_reviews.title: FRESH!!!
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing like a freshly ground cup of coffee. It had not disappointed so far .
customer_reviews.author: Jose Alfaro

customer_reviews.title: Clogs
customer_reviews.text: Jammed after two weeks use. Doesn't help to clean it, jams again after first use
customer_reviews.author: Oscar E. Wilson Jr. D.V.M.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job with minimal noise.
customer_reviews.text: Grinder has been working great, hope it last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Not lucky.
customer_reviews.text: It stop grinding after one week. Cusinart informed me that a replace should arrive in the following days.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have used it everyday for a month and have not had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Puzzlequeen

customer_reviews.title: Fool Me Twice...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered first one and it jammed and motor stopped. Had it replaced and it worked for 10 min, then stopped, disassembled, per instructions, and reassembled and still jammed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Should have ordered long ago
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and use. The grinder is quiet and dispenses the correct amount of ground coffee according to the setting. i've had other grinders which dispense either too much or too little for the setting. Important to note- the ground coffee stays in the hopper. With other brands I've had "coffee powder" spray out from the top or sides of the hopper. This quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Coffee Man

customer_reviews.title: NIGHTMARE......SAVE YOURSELF :(
customer_reviews.text: ON NUMBER 4. Amazon replaced the first one and Cuisinart replaced 3 of these. One worked 1 usage. One about 2 months. One worked a few times. One replacement of another model did not turn on. I am now waiting for another replacement of another model that is back-ordered. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Sought and Found

customer_reviews.title: Update after 5 days
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this grinder until today. I pushed the button to grind, and nothing just the motor spinning. I took apart the grinder and cleaned it the best I could. I couldn't get the grinding basket (with the handle out the little handle kept coming off. I'm returning the grinder. It's hard to find a good grinder. I had the older model Cuisinart for about three years without a problem then it just pooped out. I'll keep my little grinder for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Gordie

customer_reviews.title: Quit working like others who reviewed this product after about 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This product was good for about a month or two and now has stopped working. It is also very messy because it uses a lot of plastic parts which cause even more static electricity. Other than that I liked the design and the consistency of a burr grinder
customer_reviews.author: jwthomas87

customer_reviews.title: Poor product
customer_reviews.text: Sadly I threw the box away, so I could not send it back. I could not get it the works, the coffee beans just did not grind. I had 2 other friends try to use it with the same result.
customer_reviews.author: Evs

customer_reviews.title: Jambed
customer_reviews.text: Jammed in a week can’t get it cleaned out and threw in the box. Made good coffee with fine grounds but now it’s useless.Jammed in a week can’t get it cleaned out and threw in the box. Made good coffee with fine grounds but now it’s useless
customer_reviews.author: LGR

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a very crappy items spent a lot of money for it and it constantly gets stuck and clogged and stops working! I wouldn't buy this product. bought this in June and already having so many issues.
customer_reviews.author: MC2

customer_reviews.title: Clogs up one or two times a week
customer_reviews.text: Very messy to clean up, ground coffee ends up under the machine on the counter, clogs to often, hard to clean, does not grind properly, and very poor design even though It did look good next to my Cuisinart espresso machine. The on-line demo with all the options sold me on taking a chance. I returned the grinder, upgraded to one that works better over all, costing about $70 more.
customer_reviews.author: JED

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 1 week. This may be ok to use once in awhile but if you grind a lot of coffee would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bean Grinder
customer_reviews.text: very good grinder it has been precise in what I select quiet enough to run when people are sleeping A little bit of static in the container but not bad I have used various selections to test and it has been constant every time 3year warranty to is good to have that came with
customer_reviews.author: C Wood

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and consistent grind
customer_reviews.text: Many grind settings and can place catch basket up to it or grind directly into bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jorova

customer_reviews.title: decent value although not 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Would have given a 5 star but it is a little messy. The grounds don't all make it into the container and fly around a bit. Overall pretty good and good for the $
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Quality and performance
customer_reviews.text: Best coffee grinder I have found. Thoughtful design elements combine to enhance performance. Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Grinder!!
customer_reviews.text: Grinder has worked perfectly. I have not encountered any problems like other reviewers. This is my first grinder and I couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: JLP

product_meta.title: Cuisinart Deluxe Grind Conical Burr Mill, One Size, Silver
product_meta.description:
The perfect grind has never been easier. Cuisinart's Premium Conical Burr Grinder grinds coffee beans uniformly, maintaining natural flavors and oils for great tasting coffee. Grinds right into a coffee filter or grounds container for ultimate convenience, and lets users choose from 18 grind settings - ultra-fine for espresso to extra-coarse for French press. Grind only what's needed to ensure the freshest flavor, or grind more and store in the lidded container. Internal, professional-quality engineering ensures low-temperature, low-static operation. This is a truly premium-quality grinder!.

BRAND STORY
By Cuisinart
feature_bullets: Conical burr grinding ensures superior grind and consistent size
18 grind settings from ultra-fine for espresso to extra-coarse for French press
Grinds directly into a permanent or paper filter, a portafilter, or the coffee container
Select from 1 – 14 cups, for freshest flavor
Meets high standards set by the Specialty Coffee Association of America and the European Coffee Brewing Centre

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars110 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
